sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Timing
best_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

best_contributors.title: Total Sleep
best_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

worst_contributors.title: Restfulness
worst_contributors.description: Restfulness is measured by evaluating your movement and periods of wakefulness during sleep.

insights.title: How to improve Restfulness
insights.description: Stimulants like caffeine and nicotine can reduce restfulness, even if consumed 5-6 hours before sleep. Try limiting their intake well before your sleep window.

worst_contributors.title: HR Drop
worst_contributors.description: HR drop is defined as the time it takes for your heart rate to reach its lowest point during sleep. This marker indicates your rest and recovery quality. The earlier the drop occurs, the better your recovery and the more rested you will be.

insights.title: How to improve HR Drop
insights.description: You can help your heart rate drop early during sleep by avoiding stimulants and physical exercise later in the day. Establishing a calming pre-sleep routine, such as reading or gentle stretching, can further promote relaxation. Winding down closer to your bedtime is a beneficial practice that increases the likelihood of your heart rate dropping early, improving overall sleep quality.

worst_contributors.title: Sleep Efficiency
worst_contributors.description: This measures the amount of time your body spends resting and repairing while you are in bed.

insights.title: How to improve Sleep Efficiency
insights.description: You can achieve higher sleep efficiency by being in a relaxed state before bed. Improve this by following a sleep ritual, such as taking a warm shower, listening to calming music, or taking magnesium supplements.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric reflects your HRV patterns and variations, which indicate your body's adaptability.

best_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
best_contributors.description: Resting Heart Rate (RHR) is an indicator of your overall cardiovascular health and fitness level. A lower RHR typically signifies better cardiovascular fitness and efficient heart function, while a higher RHR can indicate stress, overtraining, dehydration, or potential health issues.

best_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
best_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

worst_contributors.title: Movement Index
worst_contributors.description: This represents your overall movement trends.

insights.title: How to improve Movement Index
insights.description: Instead of concentrating all your effort into a single session, try to move more frequently throughout the day. While the overall volume of movement is beneficial, more frequent activity enhances blood circulation and improves posture.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. Its a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric tracks the number of days you were highly active and the number of workouts you completed, providing a long-term measure of your overall activity.

best_contributors.title: Active Hours
best_contributors.description: This measures how active you are for at least one period each hour throughout the day.

worst_contributors.title: Steps
worst_contributors.description: This indicates the number of steps you've taken and how they compare to your usual routine.

insights.title: How to improve Steps Score
insights.description: Getting most of your steps in early is a great way to increase your chances of reaching your daily step goal.
